newsitem.title: USA: Carver takes $1.2 mln chrg in mortgage buy.
newsitem.headline: Carver takes $1.2 mln chrg in mortgage buy.

text.p: Carver Bancorp Inc, holding company for Carver Federal Savings Bank, said Monday the bank has agreed to purchase about $100 million of performing one-to-four family adjustable rate mortgage loans, which would necessitate a one-time pretax charge of $1.2 million.
The loans are being purchased in two separately negotiated transactions, approximately $50 million from Chase Manhattan Bank and approximately $50 million from Countrywide Home Loans Inc.
The company projects that the acquisition of these loans, scheduled to close March 31, will raise total assets to about $400 million.

The purchases, said the company, will be funded through the sale of $72 million of money market rate investment securities and $28 million of borrowings from the Federal Home Loan Bank of New York. The sale of the securities is expected to result in a one-time pre-tax charge to earnings of approximately $1.2 million.
Carver operates seven full service branches in the New York City boroughs of Brooklyn, Queens and Manhattan and in Nassau County.
